page.title: List of tools to create Live USB systems

rev.diff:
Line 5: Line 5:
*[[Ubuntu Live USB creator]], the tool included in Ubuntu 8.10, installs Ubuntu, runs only on Linux.
*[[Ubuntu Live USB creator]], the tool included in Ubuntu 8.10, installs Ubuntu, runs only on Linux.
*[http://packages.debian.org/lenny/live-magic live-magic], is part of the [[Debian]] project. Can create various image types (CD, USB, netboot, webboot). A separate graphical interface for it, called live-magic is available.
*[http://packages.debian.org/lenny/live-magic live-magic], is part of the [[Debian]] project. Can create various image types (CD, USB, netboot, webboot). A separate graphical interface for it, called live-magic is available.
â
*[[Mandriva Seed]] installs Mandriva from version 2009.1 onwards, runs on Windows and Linux.
+
*[http://wiki.mandriva.com/en/2010.0_What%27s_New#Netbook_friendly Mandriva Seed] installs Mandriva from version 2009.1 onwards, runs on Windows and Linux.
*[[LinuxLive USB Creator]] installs and virtualize [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], [[Debian]] and many other [[Linux distribution]]s. Runs on [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] only.
*[[LinuxLive USB Creator]] installs and virtualize [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], [[Debian]] and many other [[Linux distribution]]s. Runs on [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] only.
*[http://aligunduz.org/FUSBi/ FUSBi], based on [[UNetbootin]], downloads distributions endorsed as 'free' by the [[Free Software Foundation|FSF]].
*[http://aligunduz.org/FUSBi/ FUSBi], based on [[UNetbootin]], downloads distributions endorsed as 'free' by the [[Free Software Foundation|FSF]].
